excerpt: Guanajuato is a city in central Mexico. It's known for its silver mining history and colonial architecture. Its network of narrow streets, alleyways and tunnels is typified by the Callejón del Beso (Alley of the Kiss), so named because the balconies are close enough for a couple to reach across and kiss. In a former granary, the Alhóndiga de Granaditas is an art and local history museum with pre-Columbian exhibits.
detail_description: Guanajuato, a city in central Mexico, is renowned for its silver mining history and colonial architecture. The network of narrow streets, alleyways, and tunnels includes the famous Callejón del Beso (Alley of the Kiss), where balconies are close enough for a couple to kiss across. The region encompasses Guanajuato City and San Miguel de Allende, both UNESCO World Heritage sites.
name: Guanajuato
address: Mexico

excerpt: Performing-arts theater built in 1873, known for its eclectic architecture & intricate interior.
detail_description: Teatro Juárez, a performing arts theater built in 1873, is a magnificent neoclassical building located in the heart of Guanajuato's main square. The exterior is adorned with massive Doric columns and a Romanesque portico featuring nine bronze statues of the Greek muses. The plush Art Nouveau interior boasts rich gilded decor, finely carved wood, and stained glass. It serves as a popular venue for musical and dance performances.
name: Teatro Juárez
address: De Sopena 10, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: This well-known attraction exhibits 100+ mummified bodies, along with an explanatory video.
detail_description: The Museum of the Mummies of Guanajuato is a popular attraction that displays over 100 mummified bodies, accompanied by an informative video. These naturally preserved remains date back to the mid-19th century when locals succumbed to a cholera outbreak. The museum's origins stem from cemetery staff exhuming bodies between 1865 and 1958 due to unpaid taxes, subsequently charging visitors for viewing.
name: Museum of the Mummies of Guanajuato
address: Explanada del Panteón Municipal s/n, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Narrow alley with steep steps known for a tragic love story that draws couples to its site to kiss.
detail_description: Cjon. del Beso, also known as the Alley of the Kiss, is a narrow alleyway located next to Plaza de los Angeles in Guanajuato, Mexico. This famous spot is steeped in a tragic love story that draws countless couples to visit and share a kiss on its third stair for guaranteed 7 years of happiness according to local legend. The close proximity of the walls and balconies creates an intimate atmosphere that adds to the allure of this magical place.
name: Cjon. del Beso
address: Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Cast-iron market building from the 1910s, with food stands & stalls selling straw baskets & hats.
detail_description: Mercado Hidalgo is a historic market housed in a cast-iron building dating back to the 1910s. Originally a train station, it now hosts a bustling collection of stalls selling everything from food and regional specialties to straw baskets and hats. Named after Mexican priest Miguel Hidalgo, the market offers an authentic taste of local cuisine with traditional dishes served at various food stands.
name: Mercado Hidalgo
address: Av. Benito Juárez Mercado, Hidalgo, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Art & history museum housed in a former granary used as a fortress in Mexico's War of Independence.
detail_description: The Alhóndiga de Granaditas Regional Museum is a captivating blend of art and history, housed in a former granary that played a pivotal role in Mexico's War of Independence. This historic secular building, completed in 1809, served as a granary and marketplace before becoming a fortress overrun by troops led by Miguel Hidalgo. The museum commemorates this event with a statue overlooking the city from a nearby hillside park.
name: Alhóndiga de Granaditas Regional Museum
address: C. Mendizábal 6, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Compact museum exhibiting sketches & paintings by Diego Rivera in the home where he once lived.
detail_description: Diego Rivera's House Museum is a compact museum located in the historic center of Guanajuato, Mexico. It was opened in 1975 and is housed in the building where Diego Rivera was born. The museum spans three floors, with the ground floor meticulously recreated to reflect the house as it was during Rivera's childhood. Visitors can explore six rooms filled with period furniture and family paintings. The museum honors the life and work of Diego Rivera, showcasing sketches and paintings by the artist.
name: Diego Rivera's House Museum
address: Positos 47, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Monument dedicated to a hero of the War of Independence, set on a hill with panoramic views.
detail_description: The Monumento Al Pipila is a tribute to a local hero of the War of Independence, situated on a hill that offers breathtaking panoramic views of Guanajuato. Visitors can reach the monument by climbing stairs or taking the city's old funicular from Teatro Juarez. The colossal statue depicts Pipila holding a torch with his right arm raised and left arm resting on a stone slab.
name: Monumento Al Pipila
address: Cerro de San Miguel S/N, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: When visiting Guanajuato, a ride on the funicular is a must-do experience. The funicular takes you up to the Mirador Panoramica, offering breathtaking views of the city with its colorful houses and historic architectural gems. At sunset, the city lights up and the sky casts beautiful pink hues over everything. Another way to enjoy stunning views is by visiting the Monumento al Pipila, which commemorates local hero Juan Jose Martinez.
name: Funicular
address: De La Constancia 17, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: This stately 17th-century church has a statue of the Virgin Mary dating from the 8th century.
detail_description: The Basílica Colegiata de Nuestra Señora de Guanajuato is a must-visit 17th-century church in the heart of Guanajuato. This colorful red-and-yellow basilica stands out as the most prominent church in the city, with its striking architecture easily visible from various vantage points. Inside, visitors can admire a jewel-covered statue of the Virgin Mary, which dates back to the 8th century and holds historical significance.
name: Basílica Colegiata de Nuestra Señora de Guanajuato
address: C. Ponciano Aguilar 7, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

name: University of Guanajuato
address: C. Pedro Lascurain de Retana #5, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza de La Paz is a must-see among the plazas in Guanajuato. Its triangular shape and the stunning yellow Basilica of Guanajuato as a backdrop make it a picturesque spot. While there are limited benches and shade, it's an ideal location for capturing beautiful photographs.
name: Pl. De La Paz
address: Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Museum featuring art & craft exhibits related to Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra's "Don Quixote."
detail_description: The Museo Iconográfico del Quijote is a museum in Guanajuato, Mexico that pays tribute to the iconic literary character Don Quixote created by Miguel de Cervantes. Established in 1987, the museum features a diverse collection of artwork and artifacts related to Cervantes' famous novel. Visitors can explore numerous paintings, sculptures, tapestries, ceramics, and other materials adorned with images of the beloved knight errant.
name: Museo Iconográfico del Quijote
address: Cantarranas 2, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Presa de La Olla is a hidden gem in Guanajuato, popular among local tourists. Visitors can rent paddleboats or row boats for a nominal fee and enjoy a leisurely time on the lake. It's a great spot to bring some snacks, feed the ducks, and explore the surrounding parks. Additionally, there are food vendors offering delicious treats around the area.
name: Presa de La Olla
address: Barrio de la Presa, 36094 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Regional fare, plus salads & pasta, at a casual stop with tables on a bridge across a cobbled alley.
detail_description: Santo Café is a popular restaurant in Guanajuato known for its regional cuisine and casual atmosphere. Despite being a tourist hotspot, the restaurant takes pride in offering delicious food, including several vegan options. Its prime location on a bridge allows guests to enjoy views of Guanajuato's beautiful architecture while dining outside. The café also offers a cozy and welcoming ambiance, making it an ideal spot for coffee enthusiasts.
name: Santo Café
address: Campanero, Del Campanero 4, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: This stately 17th-century residence with numerous gardens is now a museum with period furnishings.
detail_description: Nestled just a few kilometers west of Guanajuato's bustling center, the Museo Ex Hacienda San Gabriel de Barrera is a stunning 17th-century estate that has been transformed into a captivating museum. This expansive property spans over 22,000 square meters and features beautifully restored colonial architecture alongside lush gardens designed in various international styles. Visitors can wander through the elegant interiors filled with period furnishings, paintings, and rugs that reflect the opulence of its former residents, the Barrera family.
name: Museo Ex Hacienda San Gabriel de Barrera
address: KM 2.5, Guanajuato- Marfil, El Cerrito, 36050 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: At the Ex Hacienda de San Gabriel de Barrera, you'll find a charming setting for capturing special moments like First Communion photos. The historic hacienda provides a picturesque backdrop, perfect for creating lasting memories.
name: Ex. Hda. San Gabriel de Barrera
address: San Gabriel de Barrera, 36050 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

name: Templo de la Compañía de Jesús Oratorio de San Felipe Neri
address: Plazuela de Compañia 1, C. del Sol 16, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

name: Templo de San Francisco
address: Cantarranas 15, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Hilltop monument to a hero of the Mexican War of Independence, offering views of the city center.
detail_description: Mirador Hacia El Pipila is a hilltop monument in Guanajuato, Mexico, dedicated to a hero of the Mexican War of Independence. It offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city center, especially at sunset when the city lights start coming on. Visitors can reach the monument by climbing up many stairs or taking a trolley. The funicular is also an option but comes with a cost.
name: Mirador Hacia El Pipila
address: Subterranea 7, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza de San Fernando, situated in the former Hacienda de San Francisco de Cervera, is a must-visit destination in Guanajuato. The cobblestone paving of this iconic plaza was artistically designed by Jose Chavez Morado. Surrounded by traditional buildings hosting an array of restaurants and cafes, it has earned a reputation as one of the liveliest plazas in Guanajuato.
name: Plaza de San Fernando
address: Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Shady garden plaza with manicured trees, terrace cafes, a fountain & an elegant bandstand.
detail_description: Jardin de la Union is a charming plaza in the heart of the old city, featuring manicured trees, terrace cafes, and an elegant bandstand. It's a favorite gathering place for locals and visitors alike, bustling with activity from morning until late at night. The plaza is surrounded by cultural attractions such as Teatro Juarez and several museums, offering something for every taste.
name: Jdn. de la Unión
address: Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Narrow alley with steep steps known for a tragic love story that draws couples to its site to kiss.
detail_description: Callejón del Beso, also known as the Alley of the Kiss, is a narrow alleyway located in the historic zone of Guanajuato. This popular attraction is famous for its tragic love story involving a rich daughter and a poor miner who would meet in the alley to kiss. The story ended in tragedy when the woman's father discovered their love and killed her in disapproval. The alley is brightly painted and has become a symbol of Mexico's own Romeo & Juliet tale.
name: Callejón del Beso
address: Belén 22, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: This 18th-century pink stone church sits on a hillside & has an ornate interior with gold-leaf art.
detail_description: Templo de San Cayetano Confesor is an 18th-century pink stone church located in the city center of Guanajuato. It played a significant role in the opening of the La Valenciana mine and is renowned for its ornate interior featuring gold-leaf art. The church showcases Mexican Churrigueresque style with luxurious plated special stepped areas, carvings, and artwork.
name: Templo de San Cayetano Confesor
address: Carretera a Guanajuato Dolores Hidalgo, MIneral Km 1.5, Valenciana, 36023 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Café Tal is a charming coffee spot in town, known for its great coffee and cozy atmosphere. It's a combination of a roastery and a coffee shop, spread across two buildings with seating on two levels. The café offers an array of delicious drinks, including the popular mochas and cortados. Visitors can enjoy their beverages while observing the bustling street outside through the windows. Additionally, Café Tal is pet-friendly and serves one of the best chocolates in town called 'Beso Negro.'
name: Café Tal
address: Temescuitate 1 4, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Elegant boutique hotel offering contemporary quarters & a spa, plus a rooftop bar & a restaurant.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Guanajuato, 1850 Hotel Boutique is a stylish and modern hotel housed in a historic building dating back to 1850. The hotel offers contemporary accommodations, a full-service spa for relaxation, and a rooftop bar with panoramic views of the city. With its quirky art pieces and rotating installations, the hotel exudes a Mexico City vibe rather than traditional Spanish colonialism.
name: 1850 Hotel Boutique
address: Jdn. de la Unión 7, Centro Histórico de la Cdad. de México, Zona Centro, 36250 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: This unique small museum features historical & modern art, including paintings & sculptures.
detail_description: The Museo del Pueblo de Guanajuato is a small yet unique museum that offers a blend of historical and modern art. It showcases Colonial-era art and artifacts alongside rotating exhibits of contemporary Mexican artwork. The museum, housed in a historic mansion, features paintings, sculptures, and Mexican miniatures that have been passed down through generations. Additionally, it collaborates with international institutions to bring diverse exhibitions to its visitors.
name: Museo del Pueblo de Guanajuato
address: Positos 7, Zona Centro, 36070 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Nestled in a picturesque setting, Presa San Renovato is the perfect destination for those looking to unwind and connect with nature. This stunning locale offers visitors a chance to immerse themselves in the local flora and fauna while enjoying breathtaking views. Whether you're planning a family outing, a romantic escape, or a fun day with friends, this beautiful spot caters to all.
name: Presa San Renovato
address: Los Ameros, Guanajuato, Mexico

detail_description: Truco 7 Restaurant is a traditional Mexican eatery located off of Plaza de la Paz on Calle Truco. It offers good food at reasonable prices, making it a popular choice for locals and visitors alike. The restaurant serves up Mexican classics and other international cuisines, with generous portions at affordable prices. With its romantic candlelit setting, it's an ideal spot for a romantic dinner in the heart of Guanajuato.
name: Truco 7 Restaurant
address: Del Truco 7, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: The Universidad de Guanajuato: Dirección de Investigación y Posgrado, established in 1732 and recognized as a university in 1945, is housed in a neoclassical building constructed from green quarry. With over 33,000 students enrolled in various programs, the university offers a blend of historical charm and academic excellence. The impressive architecture and well-preserved interior details make it a captivating place to visit.
name: Universidad de Guanajuato: Dirección de Investigación y Posgrado
address: C. Pedro Lascurain de Retana 5, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: La Clave Azul Restaurante Taberna is a small, hidden gem located in Guanajuato. The bar features small, irregularly shaped rooms with rock walls and rustic furniture connected by narrow stairways. It's known for its bohemian vibe and friendly owner. Visitors can enjoy complimentary botanas, Mexican snacks served with drinks, between 2:00 and 5:30 pm.
name: La Clave Azul Restaurante Taberna
address: Cjon. Segunda de Cantaritos 31, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Restaurante Casa Mercedes is renowned as one of the top dining spots in Guanajuato, offering high-quality dishes prepared with excellence in a delightful atmosphere. While not centrally located, this restaurant's relatively short menu features exquisite options like the montadito de nopal, chorizo de atun ahumado, chile ancho relleno, and pan de elote for dessert.
name: Restaurante Casa Mercedes
address: Calle, De Arriba 6, San Javier, 36020 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Mestizo is a top dining spot in Guanajuato, offering a menu featuring high-quality dishes. The restaurant, owned by chef Javier Cruz Hernandez Vallejo, is located in his father's downtown gallery and boasts a charming atmosphere with artistic decor. The food is served with flair and features a fusion of traditional Mexican and European cuisine. The restaurant's vibrant ambiance and menu have earned it high ratings on Trip Advisor.
name: Mestizo
address: Positos 69, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Romantic, French-inspired cafe serving coffee, sweets & traditional plates like beef bourguignon.
detail_description: La Vie en Rose is a charming French-inspired cafe and bakery located in Guanajuato. It has quickly become a favorite among locals and visitors alike since its opening in 2014. The cafe offers a variety of traditional French dishes, including beef bourguignon, as well as an assortment of delectable pastries and sweets. Owned by a French family, the cafe exudes an elegant and romantic ambiance, making it the perfect spot for a leisurely meal or a quick coffee break.
name: La Vie en Rose
address: Cantarranas 18, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Golem Restaurant Bar is a unique and divey spot located atop one of the city's historic tunnels from the late 1800s. The bar offers traditional Mexican cuisine and classic domestic beer, making it a great place to hang out with friends. With its four levels, including a rooftop terrace, Golem has different corners to explore, each with its own personality and ambiance.
name: Golem Restaurant Bar
address: Cantarranas 1-y 3, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza Baratillo, located in Guanajuato City, is a charming plaza adorned with a striking bronze fountain at its heart. The vibrant surroundings consist of colorful buildings and narrow alleys that branch out in various directions. Once serving as the local market over a century ago, today it offers a tranquil atmosphere with boutique shops, eateries, and cafes dotting its perimeter.
name: Plaza Baratillo
address: 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: The Festival Internacional Cervantino is Mexico's largest and most impressive performing arts event, taking place in Guanajuato from October 7-25. The festival offers an eclectic and imaginative lineup of performances, including a Belgian orchestra playing Beethoven's symphonies on period instruments, an electric Afro-pop show from Mali, and traditional South American dances by a renowned Peruvian ensemble.
name: Festival Internacional Cervantino
address: Jdn. de la Unión, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Colorful, neoclassical structures surround this charming town square & a small fountain.
detail_description: Plaza de Los Angeles, also known as Plaza of the Angels, is a charming town square surrounded by colorful neoclassical structures and a small fountain. It's a popular spot for travelers, street performers, and musicians. The annual festival El Cervantino takes place here, adding to the lively atmosphere. This bustling plaza is located near the iconic Callejon del Beso and features candy-colored buildings, a central fountain, and numerous street food stalls that contribute to its vibrant ambiance.
name: Plaza de Los Angeles
address: Subida de La Mula, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: The architecture of Universidad de Guanajuato is quite remarkable, sparking some controversy due to its dominating presence over the surrounding historic colonial style of the city.
name: Universidad de Guanajuato
address: C. Tepetapa, Carrizo, 36030 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: Los Campos is a highly regarded restaurant in Guanajuato, offering the best traditional cuisine at great prices. The menu features classic recipes made with high-quality ingredients, including must-try dishes like Aztec guacamole, artisanal cheese selection, quesadillas, and tacos. Additionally, Los Campos is known for its Mexican-style tapas and unique offerings such as seasoned grasshoppers. Guests can also enjoy a variety of mezcal options and live music with advance reservations.
name: Los Campos
address: Del Campanero 11, Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Cozy rooms with ceiling fans in a down-to-earth hotel offering breakfast & Wi-Fi.
detail_description: Hotel de la Paz is a down-to-earth accommodation located in the heart of Guanajuato, just a short walk from popular attractions like Alley of the Kiss and Mummies Museum. The hotel offers cozy rooms with ceiling fans and complimentary Wi-Fi. Guests can enjoy a complimentary full breakfast served daily and take advantage of amenities such as a terrace, tour/ticket assistance, and laundry facilities. The 15 air-conditioned rooms feature LCD televisions and free wireless internet access.
name: Hotel de la Paz
address: Del Estudiante 1, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Guided tours are offered of this dark, historic dungeon with torture chambers of the past.
detail_description: Museo ex Hacienda del Cochero offers guided tours of its historic dungeon and torture chambers, providing a glimpse into the past. The tour, primarily in Spanish, showcases beautifully restored features and an interesting array of plants on the property. Visitors should be prepared for extensive walking, including through a deep tunnel. While entry is affordable at 65 pesos, tipping the guide is customary. The museum also provides great views of the surrounding mountains and greenery.
name: Museo ex Hacienda del Cochero
address: Antiguo, Cam. Real #196, Valenciana, 36023 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: 16th- to 18th-century art, ceramics, glassware & furnishings in the unique home of 2 artists.
detail_description: This museum contains a large collection of paintings and art from the 16th to 19th century. The building has been home to two internationally renowned artists.
name: Museo de Arte Olga Costa - José Chávez Morado
address: C. Pastita 158, Pastita, 36090 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Excavated underground remains of a 17th-century cloister, with traces of the original frescoes.
detail_description: The Museo Ex Convento Dieguino is an old convent that was excavated and opened to the public in 2007. It contains the remains of a convent from the 17th century and provides an understanding of city level changes since it was constructed. The museum is open every day from 10:00AM to 6:30PM and offers beautiful architecture, interesting history, and great views at night.
name: Museo ex Convento Dieguino
address: Bajos del Templo de San Diego, De Sopena, Zona Centro, 36172 Guanajuato, Mexico

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Guanajuato, Jardin Embajadoras is a delightful destination that offers a vibrant mix of local culture and culinary delights. This charming spot is perfect for leisurely strolls where you can indulge in street food, shop for flowers, shoes, clothes, and fresh produce. On Sundays, keep an eye out for Jesus at his clothing stall near the bank; he’s known for his friendly demeanor and fantastic deals on quality men's apparel.
name: Jardin Embajadoras
address: P.º de La Presa, Zona Centro, 36094 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Historical venue with displays on notable local sites & stories, such as the well-known mummies.
detail_description: Casa de las Leyendas is a historical venue in Guanajuato that brings to life the city's legends through animated replicas and displays. Visitors can immerse themselves in the tragic and humorous myths of the area, including stories about mummies, miners, and the famous Alley of the Kiss. The exhibits cover a range of local urban legends dramatized with basic robotics, making it an intriguing experience for those interested in scary stories.
name: Casa de las Leyendas
address: Panorámica, Cerro de los Leones, 36090 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Narrow alley with steep steps known for a tragic love story that draws couples to its site to kiss.
name: Callejón del Beso
address: Belén 22, Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Panoramic views from the top of the hill with a 65-ft. bronze Christ statue & art deco sanctuary.
detail_description: The Shrine of Christ the King is a stunning destination perched atop a hill, offering visitors breathtaking panoramic views of Silao and Guanajuato. Dominated by a magnificent 65-foot bronze statue of Christ and an art deco sanctuary, this site is not only visually captivating but also spiritually enriching. Many come here to pray, reflect, or shop for religious souvenirs in a serene atmosphere that fosters devotion and gratitude.
name: Shrine of Christ the King
address: Cerro del Cubilete S/N, El Cubilete, la Montaña, 36290 Silao de la Victoria, Gto., Mexico

excerpt: Visitors can tour this large house & hear spooky stories accompanied by light & sound effects.
detail_description: Casa de Tía Aura is a captivating destination for those who enjoy a good scare. Nestled in an ancient colonial house, this museum offers visitors an immersive experience filled with chilling legends and tales of past horrors, all enhanced by impressive light and sound effects. The atmosphere is delightfully eerie, making it perfect for thrill-seekers looking to explore the darker side of history.
name: Casa de Tía Aura
address: P.º de La Presa 62, Barrio de la Presa, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico

detail_description: The Iglesia de San Diego is a historic church located near the Teatro Juarez in Guanajuato. It's a popular starting point for tours, including the Estudiantina tour that leads to Callejon del Beso. The church, along with the nearby Jardin de la Union and Teatro Juarez, offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle.
name: Iglesia de San Diego
address: Zona Centro, 36000 Guanajuato, Gto., Mexico
